Dear Mr. Ejor, Esq.


Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Harry Shipman, M.D. , the
personal physician of Barnabas Roberts. Regrettably I must inform you
that Mr. Roberts passed away suddenly late yesterday afternoon, just
before sunset. My patient was a very sick man and we can all be relieved
that his suffering has finally ceased. As you may know, a rare blood
disease rendered Mr. Roberts highly susceptible to bright light, a
condition which proved to be his downfall. Apparently an unthinking
visitor opened the curtains in his room yesterday afternoon. The
prolonged exposure to the sun's setting rays proved fatal. :-( 


I spent the better part of this day taking care of bureaucratic
formalities and just finished arrangements to have his belongings
shipped back to his estate. I discovered in his appointment calendar his
notice to meet with you in Amsterdam. Having noted the e-mail address I
felt it best to inform you of the situation so you will not wait in
vain. I do not know what business he had with you, or perhaps you are a
friend or former business associate he wished to greet. Before taking
ill Mr. Roberts was quite involved in his family's shipbuilding
business, through which he has made many contacts all over the world.


I might add a few words in closing. Although Barnabas Roberts was
struggling with a terrible illness, it seemed to me in the last weeks
that he had found a new lease on life, a sudden burst of energy, as if
some positive project had given him hope. Perhaps in some way you had a
role in this. If that is the case, all of us who knew Barnabas owe you a
debt of gratitude.


If I may be of service to you, please do not hesitate to contact me. But
for now I am exhausted and must get some sleep, will fly back to Maine
tomorrow.


In sad memory,
Harry Shipman, M.D.

Waldorf Flywheel




Dear Mr. Ejor,


My name is Waldorf T. Flywheel of Flywheel, Shyster and Flywheel,
attorneys at law. I am the family attorney to the late Mr. Barnabas
Roberts, former shipbuilding magnate, hereafter referred to as my
client. My client passed away recently during travels in Europe and it
has now fallen under my obligation, serving as executor to the estate,
to locate all the beneficiaries to my client's vast holdings. 


Well, it has been a frustrating task. My late client's entire fortune:
his vault of over $666,000,000 US Dollars in cash guarded by live
wolves, a lovely old mansion near Collinsport, Maine, and a metal strong
box containing erotic Dutch language publications, has been bequeathed
to the "Pitt Roberts Memorial Fund". This is all well and good, but I
have had no success in locating such an entity. We have searched all
official records, Roberts family archives, and google, but to no avail.


In desperation we attempted a search of known relatives: there was a
cousin named Pitt Roberts who dropped out of sight several decades ago.
This, however, turned out to be a cold lead. My office performed a
comprehensive study of all obituaries in every major newspaper of the
world since 1970 and discovered that Pitt Roberts and all of his family
passed away in a car accident several years ago. We suspect that the
so-called memorial fund may have something to do with Pitt Roberts.


Having failed to locate either the "Pitt Roberts Memorial Fund" or a
next-of-kin I fear the entire assets will revert to the state government
of Maine, which intends to waste it by tearing down all public buildings
and putting up exact duplicates in their place. An upcoming appointment
in probate court will decide this. Time is therefore running out.


I am contacting you because my client apparently intended to meet with
you in Amsterdam at the time of his death. Maybe you are a relative we
do not know about. Possibly you are able to shed some light on this
mystery and assist me in paying out this fortune to the "Pitt Roberts
Memorial Fund"or a representative thereof, though I myself am skeptical
that such a fund even exists. If it does, my client succeeded in keeping
it an absolute secret. 


Please respond quickly as the matter is highly urgent.


Best wishes,


Waldorf T. Flywheel


P.S. I am a member of the Handicapped Lawyer's Association of America,
having lost my larynx in a fishing accident. Since I am unable to speak,
I prefer you contact me either via e-mail or fax: 764-5396

trust as we proceed, because the truth must prevail, but one is a little
at lost as to what evidence you will need to satify your curiosity and
avoid any possible doubts.

only documented evidence readily in my mind is sending you the Death
certificate of Mr Pitt Roberts and copies of my Office

APPRECIATE you to send your's to me upon receipt of mine, for better
acquaintance, trust and confidence which is essential to the success of
our transaction. We shall also be complementing this with regular
telephone discussions. 


However, Let me quickly start by expressing my delight again at your
response to my proposal. I will then leave the rest to God with the
fullest conviction that our efforts so far would be blessed by his
grace. 


There is nothing more to add in respect of our working relationship, as
I assume that you have accepted my said proposal and heard of my honest
position. Be assured that the procedures to be adopted in processing and
effecting the transfer is fully official and legal. But let me impress
it on you that this will demand of us some finacial obligations in
respect of official expenses to be incured in the course of documenting
the claim and transfer in your favour. 


In as much as I have assured you that all the major requirements to be
demanded by the finance company are within my disposal and reach, there
are some which we shall have to acquire through laid down legal
processes at the court. None the less, I have made my personal
arrangement for this expenses, and would only call for your assistance. 


Having said that, let me brief you with the official processes to be
involved in the transaction. Our main focus is to first, present you to
the finance company as the next of kin to my late client, and further
apply that his entitlement be transfered to you through the said legal
processes. 


We shall start by sending a formal application to this effect. I will
copy you with the text of the said claim and transfer application to
this effect. You will be required to send the application directly to
the finance company by fax. The text of the application will follow at
the bottom of this message. 


Thereafter, the finance company will request of you the relevant back up
documents to your claim and application according to the demand of our
probate law for tansfer of inheritance. I am on the stand by to provide
you with all their requirements from the stock of documents which is
presently with me. Otherwise, I will facilitate our acquisition of any
one demanded outside my possesion. 


Once we have provided the finance company with their demands, they would
now be under legal obligation to transfer the funds to your submitted
bank account. Please note that your application of claim will be
complimented by all legal award we shall have to seek from the federal
high court. You are not to worry about this, as I will easilly secure
that with the benefit of my professional competence and influence. It will only cost us some official expenses. 


As we proceed, the processes and demands of this transaction will become
clearer to you. All we need do now is to commence operation effectively
by getting you to send the claim application to the finance company.
This will follow at the end of this message, including the sending
instruction. 


Finanlly, I want to remind you again of the need and importance of
utmost confidentiality and your full adhereance to my instruction to our
success. With all due respect, I expect the highest level of your
compliance to my instructions, even when they seem foolish in your view.
I am the expert and anchorman here, and must be granted all the benefit
of doubt in the discharge of my professional expertise. 


Let me also remind you that you must be willing to commit not just your financial contribution to the processing of the transfer, but you must
be ready to give it the time and attention it demands. 


Once these understanding are perfectly implemented, then we are bound to
meet in your country to celebrate our successful transaction in a matter
of days. 


Above all, I personally count on the will and blessing of the almigthy
God to facilitate our plan and understanding, to produce not just
success, but also peaceful sharing of the funds at the end of the day
and a healthy family business relationship thereafter. 


I then expect you to send the following text application immediately to
the finance company's fax number: 234-1-7596330.or Email:
citytrust-fin@financier.com 


Please Could you kindly call me upon receipt of this message for voice
identification and forward immediately the application to the Finance
Company. My direct number is: 234-803-334-8897.


I await for your call, 


Regards, 


Barr.DANIEL.

Dear and Most Honorable Ejor,


Thank you for your comprehensive correspondence on the matter at hand. I
have studied the material and have a wonderful counter-proposal to make
that I believe will immediately convince you of its rightness.


I am a wealthy philanthropist with a respect for money and a strong
belief in giving blood. My thoughts have been how best to dispose of
this sudden windfall in a manner keeping with the name of Roberts and I
have decided to entrust you with the realization of my exciting idea. 


First I must explain a little about Pitt Roberts, whom I believe is my
long lost second cousin. In the mid-sixties when we were both children
and played together Pitt and I were inseparable friends. A family
argument among our elders split the family apart, and all we know is
Pitt's father took that branch of the family to Europe. Pitt's mother
had died earlier during childbirth and we later learned that Pitt's
father died in Europe of a rare blood disease that runs in our family.
We have not heard from Pitt since.


This is the background for my proposal and I am positive that Pitt would
have found it worthy of his name. I do not want a single penny of the
money in question, rather I wish for you to open a trust fund entitled
the "Pitt Roberts Memorial Fund" (please use this exact name). The
funds, less a percentage to reward you for your role in the matter and
to compensate you for your expenses, shall be transferred to the
aforementioned trust fund and used for the worthy cause of making
Sagbama Express Road safe*. Traffic lights and radar cameras must be
installed, and speed limits enforced, if necessary by security personnel
hired via the trust fund. I think if you make a list of the top ten most
dangerous roads in the world, Sagbama Express Road makes it into the top
five. I have done my own research and find it is not uncommon for entire
families to be wiped out in fatal accidents on the Sagbama Road.
Dependents of accident victims could also be supported by the funds, and
perhaps a college education paid for, so that they will not be left
destitute by their unfortunate destinies.

Daniel,


I am completely crestfallen by the terrible mishap that has occurred.
The worst of it being your fruitless wait for me at the airport,
thinking God knows what when I did not show up. The truth is I
overestimated my ability to withstand the rigors of a bright, sunlit
sky. The illness which renders me ultrasensitive to daylight has struck
me again. It was still dark as the plane left Iceland, but suddenly, as
we flew east, the fading dawn was overwhelmed by a brightly lit day, and
the plane seemed to nearly touch the sun. I collapsed during the flight

physician has also flown in from Maine to be by my side. Anyhow, I must

patients, so I am able to surf and contact you with the hope that you
also receive my message.

pornographic magazines bound for the Dutch market.

will be on my feet soon. My physician reports I should be able to make
the  journey from Denmark to Amsterdam in a few days, via night train. I
suggest you wait this time in Amsterdam and arrange whatever formalities
remain to be taken care of. If you have extra time feel free to amuse

than I already do. Upon our meeting, soon to take place, I will
reimburse you for any additional expenses you incurred. Please do not be
upset by this sudden turn of events. Everything good is worth waiting
for.


See you soon, God willing,


Barnabas.


P.S. The finance agency wrote again threatening to confiscate the money.
I informed them of the consequences should they attempt this. But we
must move fast so that you can be back in Nigeria next week.
